response.original_title: The Last Accord: War, Apocalypse, and Peace
response.overview: This film takes viewers on an extraordinary journey through one of Southeast Asia’s longest and deadliest conflicts. For nearly 3 decades, the conflict between the Indonesian government and the Free Aceh Movement (GAM) left deep scars and generations warped by violence. This documentary offers an in-depth look at the tortuous path of the peace process in Aceh—often regarded as a mission impossible—featuring untold stories of behind-the-scenes tensions, and dramatic twists and turns that finally yielded the Helsinki Accord.
response.title: The Last Accord: War, Apocalypse, and Peace
